title: Psalm 33:1-3 REJOICE IN the Lord, O you [uncompromisingly] righteous [you upright in right standing ...

attachments.displayName:
Psalm 33:1-3 REJOICE IN the Lord, O you [uncompromisingly] righteous [you upright in right standing with God]; for praise is becoming and appropriate for those who are upright [in heart]. Give thanks to the Lord with the lyre; sing praises to Him with the harp of ten strings. Sing to Him a new song; play skillfully [on the strings] with a loud and joyful sound.

If anyone was a true worshipper it was David the Shepherd who became King ltr. At a young age David played before King Saul when an evil spirit would come around him & when he played that evil spirit would leave, saying that worship is a big part of our Prayer life. If we struggle so much then we should stop to see how much we pray & worship. The Word of God speaks to us about worship all thru it, Noah prayed & worshipped after the flood, Moses prayed & worshipped in the Mt., Daniel worshipped & prayed in the Lions den, Peter worshipped while in jail, John worshipped, the list goes on & on. Let us put some worship music on, turn that other junk off & let us worship the King of Glory, King Yeshua.

object.content:

If anyone was a true worshipper it was David the Shepherd who became King ltr. At a young age David played before King Saul when an evil spirit would come around him & when he played that evil spirit would leave, saying that worship is a big part of our Prayer life. If we struggle so much then we should stop to see how much we pray & worship. The Word of God speaks to us about worship all thru it, Noah prayed & worshipped after the flood, Moses prayed & worshipped in the Mt., Daniel worshipped & prayed in the Lions den, Peter worshipped while in jail, John worshipped, the list goes on & on.
